sen.j: 田公高家（たきみ たかいえ、生没年不詳）は安土桃山時代頃の武将で因幡国気多郡気多郡 (鳥取県)宮吉城主、通称・新介。
sen.e: Takaie TAKIMI (year of birth and death unknown), also generally called Shinsuke, was a Japanese military commander who lived around the Azuchi-Momotama period, and he was the lord of Miyayoshi-jo (宮吉城) Castle in Keta County, Inaba Province
sen.cmt: 「因幡国気多郡気多郡 (鳥取県)」とありますが、リンク先の用語とまざっているようです。ウェブを確認し、「因幡気多郡」として訳出いたしました。「宮吉城」の正式な読み方が不明です。
sen.e: Takaie TAKIMI (year of birth and death unknown), also generally called Shinsuke, was a Japanese military commander who lived around the Azuchi-Momoyama period, and he was the lord of Miyayoshi-jo (宮吉城) Castle in Keta County, Inaba Province.

Takaie TAKIMI (year of birth and death unknown), also generally called Shinsuke, was a Japanese military commander who lived around the Azuchi-Momoyama period, and he was the lord of Miyayoshi-jo (宮吉城) Castle in Keta County, Inaba Province.

sen.j: 高家は因幡守護代であった田公氏一族であった。
sen.e: Takaie was from the Takimi clan, who was Shugodai (the acting Military Governor) of Inaba Province.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Takaie was from the Takimi clan, who was Shugodai (the acting Military Governor) of Inaba Province.
Takaie was from the Takimi clan, who was Shugodai (the acting Military Governor) of Inaba Province.

sen.j: 天正8年（1580年）の豊臣秀吉の鳥取城攻めの際、毛利氏に属し、気多郡気多郡 (鳥取県)の重要な拠点の一つ宮吉城を守っていた。
sen.e: He was on the side of the Mori clan when Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI attacked Tottori-jo Castle in 1580, and he defended Miyayoshi-jo Castle, one of the important strongpoints of Keta County.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処「気多郡気多郡 (鳥取県)」とありますがリンク先の用語と混ざっているようです。ウェブを確認し「気多郡」として訳出いたしました。
sen.e: He was on the side of the Mori clan when Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI attacked Tottori-jo Castle in 1580, and he defended Miyayoshi-jo Castle, one of the important strongpoints of Keta County.
He was on the side of the Mori clan when Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI attacked Tottori-jo Castle in 1580, and he defended Miyayoshi-jo Castle, one of the important strongpoints of Keta County.

sen.j: 同9年（1581年）1月、織田氏の鹿野城主・亀井茲矩と内通した高家は謀叛を企てるが発覚してしまい、同年2月初旬には杉原盛重によって鎮圧された。
sen.e: In February 1581, Takaie secretly communicated with Korenori KAMEI, the lord of Shikano-jo Castle owned by the Oda clan, and conspired against the Mori clan, but his plan was detected before being carried out and Morishige SUGIHARA suppressed it at the beginning of March 1581.

In February 1581, Takaie secretly communicated with Korenori KAMEI, the lord of Shikano-jo Castle owned by the Oda clan, and conspired against the Mori clan, but his plan was detected before being carried out and Morishige SUGIHARA suppressed it at the beginning of March 1581.

In February 1581, Takaie secretly communicated with Korenori KAMEI, the lord of Shikano-jo Castle owned by the Oda clan, and conspired against the Mori clan, but his plan was detected before being carried out and Morishige SUGIHARA suppressed it at the beginning of March 1581.

sen.j: 妻子と共に宮吉城から逃れた高家は鹿野城へ逃れた。
sen.e: Takaie escaped from Miyayoshi-jo Castle with his wife and children to Shikano-jo Castle.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Takaie escaped from Miyayoshi-jo Castle with his wife and children to Shikano-jo Castle.
Takaie escaped from Miyayoshi-jo Castle with his wife and children to Shikano-jo Castle.

sen.j: 亀井茲矩に保護されたが、まもなく京都へ移住した。
sen.e: Korenori KAMEI gave shelter to them, and they moved to Kyoto after a while.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Korenori KAMEI gave shelter to them, and they moved to Kyoto after a while.
Korenori KAMEI gave shelter to them, and they moved to Kyoto after a while.

sen.j: 『因幡志』によれば高家は鉄砲の名手であったという。
sen.e: The "Inabashi" (History Book of Inaba Province) says Takaie was a great gun shooter.
The "Inabashi" (History Book of Inaba Province) says Takaie was a great gun shooter.
The "Inabashi" (History Book of Inaba Province) says Takaie was a great gun shooter.
